intro: Crepidomanes palmifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved crepidomanes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its large, palmately divided leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers that are typically arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories in temperate regions. Due to its unique foliage and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
